video.title: React Project Tutorial – Build a Portfolio Website w/ Advanced Animations
video.description:
In this video, you will learn how to build React portfolio website from scratch with advanced animations.

✏️ Slobodan developed this course: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBu5ulO4d-d47lAVybpRTkw

🔗 Code and assets: https://github.com/bobangajicsm/react-portfolio-website
🔗 Map library https://react-leaflet.js.org/
🔗 EmailJS library: https://www.emailjs.com/docs/examples/reactjs/
🔗 Final version: https://bobangajicsm.github.io/portfolio

Learn:
✔️  How to draw SVG animation using GSAP and React
✔️  How to animate letters on hover using Animate.css and React
✔️  How to add page loading animation using React-Loaders
✔️  How to add Pacman animation in React
✔️  How to create custom 3D CSS animations
✔️  How to implement font icons in React
✔️  How to create and implement contact form in React using EmailJS
✔️  How to add maps to your website in React using Leafleat.js

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Intro
⌨️ (0:00:43) Create React app with npx
⌨️ (0:01:01) Instaling libraries
⌨️ (0:03:56) Define global styles
⌨️ (0:06:56) Create routes
⌨️ (0:09:01) Building left sidebar
⌨️ (0:20:31) Building site layout
⌨️ (0:23:01) Building Home page
⌨️ (0:40:51) Draw SVG Logo animation
⌨️ (0:48:29) Build About page
⌨️ (1:03:56) Build page loader
⌨️ (1:06:11) Build Contact page

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

replies.author: j h
replies.text:
Yep my biggest grip the the tutorial. 

Even if you get unstuck by yourself in all the parts where he just brush off instructions, or says "instructions left in the description" but there aren't any or the instructions have changed (which to be fair its not his fault as software changes pretty fast and many libraries did that in the spawn of months since he published this tut) even if you get youself outta of those hurdles you still end up with two big problems:

1. He uses a trial version of GSPA and that doesn't work if you wanna deploy it in the real world. He responded in the comments that you just have to "not use the trial version" and doesn't elaborate further. He should've used the "non trial version" which is obviously the paid version which most people are not gonna pay here because we are broke af. Obviously.

2. We end up, as you say, hardstuck with this S logo with not even a inch of guidence on his part to modify ourselves. At least he should've give a warming at the beginning before anyone commits to this tutorial, honestly.

replies.author: Green Taco
replies.text: @Johnny P The logo's design was fine, was just annoyed I got hit with the paywall right when I tried to deploy it. Had to remove the library from my code which sucked because I had used it for other things as well, so all of it needed to be redone. Ended up adding a fade out for the svg and a fade in for the png, then a float animation after it fades in, so it worked out at the end of the day. I just feel it's something pretty important so idk why he never mentioned it, ppl will be deploying these sites so they will run into the same $100 pay wall I ran into. It was that and a few other annoyances (the cube being completely broken, putting the timeout in the cleanup function of the useEffect, barely explaining any of the EmailJS stuff) that triggered my comment, the $100 paywall was just the straw that broke the camels back.

topLevelComment.author: MrJTMoney99
topLevelComment.text:
Email JS has changed since this video uploaded. I needed to create a new template, and use the template ID, just going to the settings of a non created template will generate a new templateID over and over again. Also they have a service ID now which you need to connect your email service to the correct one and input the ID.

topLevelComment.author: Robert Minardi
topLevelComment.text: I'm going through the tutorial and I'm wondering if you can explain why you chose this naming convention for the components? You named them all index.js.... I know they're in a folder with the correct name, but that doesn't seem like a good way to set up your folders. Is there a reason for this? It seems contradictory to all the other tutorials where they name the component js file the name of the component. I'm really curious about this.

replies.author: Code with Sloba
replies.text: It's easier to import in other files, you can only add path to folder, and file gets imported by default

replies.author: Robert Minardi
replies.text:
@j h I think I found the answer. Naming them all index in each folder keeps you from having to reference the file name.
So if you have logs/index.js
To reference it in your code you stop at "logs" and it defaults to index.js.
I'd rather name then explicitly, but there could be other reasons

replies.author: Breno Veríssimo
replies.text: @Data Wizard not really, it's better to install each package locally because you might run into some project that has a dependency issue with any package you have installed globally. For instance, if you install globally a package version 2.0 and you need to work on a project that depends on the 1.0, you will need to be able to work on both without having one conflicting with the other!
